metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13286 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Xpdf 4.01.01, there is a heap-based buffer over-read in the function JBIG2Stream::readTextRegionSeg() located at JBIG2Stream.cc. It can, for example, be triggered by sending a crafted PDF document to the pdftoppm tool. It might allow an attacker to cause Information Disclosure.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2019-13286` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-cpp0v5 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
libpoppler111 - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
poppler-utils - 0.76.1-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> xpdf in koffice is 2.0 mdeslaur> poppler has extra checks, reproducer didn't work ebarretto> since 0.5.12-1 libextractor does not use xpdf anymore.

criterions.comment: poppler package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.76.1-0ubuntu4').
xpdf package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
